meanings.definition: A person who exhibits characteristics of a remote ancestor.
meanings.sent1: The atavist had the same wild eyes as his ancient forebear.
meanings.sent2: She was considered an atavist due to her uncanny resemblance to her great-great-grandmother.
meanings.sent3: The family reunion was like a gathering of atavists from different eras.
meanings.sent4: In a world of modern technology, he was a true atavist, living as if in a bygone era.
meanings.sent5: The atavist's behavior mirrored that of his ancient relatives, much to the surprise of his friends.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by atavism.
meanings.sent1: The atavist traits in the animal puzzled the scientists.
meanings.sent2: Her atavist features made her stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The old-fashioned hat gave him an atavist charm.
meanings.sent4: The ancient ruins had a haunting, atavist beauty.
meanings.sent5: The atavist design of the building harkened back to a different time.

meanings.definition: An organism that displays ancestral traits.
meanings.sent1: The plant was considered an atavist due to its primitive structure.
meanings.sent2: The atavist in the forest had characteristics unseen in modern species.
meanings.sent3: The atavist organism was a living link to the past.
meanings.sent4: The atavist creature seemed like a relic from a forgotten age.
meanings.sent5: The atavist in the zoo fascinated visitors with its ancient features.
